definition: to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Our production brigade has set aside ample reserve grain.
sentences.chinese: 生產大隊留出了充足的儲備糧。

sentences.english: Their country has set aside ample reserve grain.
sentences.chinese: 他們的國家準備充足的儲備糧。

sentences.english: Shoppin' for the winter, and it's just May, nigga.
sentences.chinese: 如今只是五月，屯好冬季儲備糧，兄弟們。

sentences.english: Article 57 of the Regulations for the Administration of Central Grain Reserves.
sentences.chinese: 《中央儲備糧管理條例》第五十七條。

sentences.english: State grain reserves management should follow two basic rules in normal conditions.
sentences.chinese: 儲備糧日常管理需要遵循兩個基本原則。

sentences.english: Our village has a grain reserve sufficient for three years.
sentences.chinese: 我們村的儲備糧夠喫三年。
